pullRequest.body:
This is a hack, and that results in `omega` having to deal with a lot of case splitting, but it is usable. 

The simp set could probably be expanded a bit, and I've left a comment inviting such changes.

This was inspired by #15817, and in particular replaces the new proof added in that PR with `by fin_omega`.

### PR summary [e9792affea](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/16651/commits/e9792affeaf6f9fe4bb531d5f98b3f143d31e577)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
There are 3411 files with changed transitive imports taking up over 146459 characters: this is too many to display!
You can run `scripts/import_trans_difference.sh all` locally to see the whole output.

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ coe_int_add_eq_ite`
`+ coe_int_add_eq_mod`
`+ coe_int_sub_eq_ite`
`+ coe_int_sub_eq_mod`
`+ emod_eq_add_self_emod`
`+ emod_eq_sub_self_emod`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>
I like a lot this PR, it will probably by very useful

Seems like a reasonable tactic, and I hope eventually `fin_omega` gets subsumed by `omega`!

bors r+

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: `fin_omega`, a wrapper around `omega` to help with `Fin` arithmetic goals.
